feed.title: Snubs
feed.subtitle: Film nerds and hosts, Caroline Young and Chris Masciarelli, discuss their favorite films snubbed at the Oscars. Alternating each week, one host must convince the other of their favorite films' deserved nomination. They discuss Oscar films and their competitive awards years, while also trying to make each other laugh.

author.name: High Tops Media & Caroline Young, Chris Masciarelli

entry.title: The Cabin in the Woods - Season 1 Episode 32

link.title: The Cabin in the Woods - Season 1 Episode 32

entry.content:
On Snubs, film fans and co-hosts, Caroline Young and Chris Masciarelli, discuss their favorite films that were snubbed by the Oscars. On this episode, our titular hosts discuss Drew Goddard’s The Cabin in the Woods, and the 2012 Academy Awards it was noticeably absent from. Caroline would’ve killed Chris if it meant saving the world, and Chris wishes Hemsworth would’ve blown the conch. They both would be down to write the prequel.

Don’t forget to follow on Instagram!
https://www.instagram.com/snubspod/

A High Tops Media Podcast
You can follow for more High Tops Media content on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter: @hightopsmedia
Check out more podcasts on our website https://hightops.media

entry.title: The Nice Guys - Season 1 Episode 31
entry.content:
On Snubs, film fans and co-hosts, Caroline Young and Chris Masciarelli, discuss their favorite films that were snubbed by the Oscars. On this episode, our titular hosts, along with special guest Jai Singh Nanda, discuss Shane Black’s The Nice Guys, and the 2017 Academy Awards it was noticeably absent from. Caroline should’ve been in the marketing department for this film, Chris still doesn’t know the difference between a lead and a supporting character, and Jai didn’t know Peter Sellers died in the 80s.

Don’t forget to follow on Instagram!
https://www.instagram.com/snubspod/

A High Tops Media Podcast
You can follow for more High Tops Media content on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter: @hightopsmedia
Check out more podcasts on our website https://hightops.media

entry.title: Blade Runner - Season 1 Episode 30
entry.content:
On Snubs, film fans and co-hosts, Caroline Young and Chris Masciarelli, discuss their favorite films that were snubbed by the Oscars. On this episode, our titular hosts discuss Ridley Scott’s, Blade Runner, and the 1983 Academy Awards it was noticeably absent from. Caroline thinks Harrison Ford is for the girls and Chris is upset over the eye gouging scenes. They both actually have an intelligent conversation as well, which is a first.

Don’t forget to follow on Instagram!
https://www.instagram.com/snubspod/

A High Tops Media Podcast
You can follow for more High Tops Media content on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter: @hightopsmedia
Check out more podcasts on our website https://hightops.media

entry.title: Emmys 2022 Recap - Season 1 Episode 29
entry.content:
On Snubs, film fans and co-hosts, Caroline Young and Chris Masciarelli, usually discuss their favorite films that were snubbed by the Oscars. On this special episode, our titular hosts recap the 2022 Emmys, and the surprise moments everyone can’t stop talking about. They also discuss some of the shows nominated, and which series and stars may have been snubbed this year. They recorded right after the show, so are both tired but excited to talk about one of their favorite events of the year. Chris could not be more happy for Michael Keaton, and Caroline believes Bill Hader was robbed.

Don’t forget to follow on Instagram!
https://www.instagram.com/snubspod/

A High Tops Media Podcast
You can follow for more High Tops Media content on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter: @hightopsmedia
Check out more podcasts on our website https://hightops.media

entry.title: History of the World: Part I (+ Venice Film Festival Recap) - Season 1 Episode 28

link.title: History of the World: Part I (+ Venice Film Festival Recap) - Season 1 Episode 28

entry.content:
On Snubs, film fans and co-hosts, Caroline Young and Chris Masciarelli, discuss their favorite films that were snubbed by the Oscars. On this episode, our titular hosts discuss Mel Brooks’ History of the World: Part I, and the 1982 Academy Awards it was noticeably absent from. They also will be discussing the 2022 Venice International Film Festival, notably the Don’t Worry Darling drama that has been taking the internet by storm. Caroline absolutely roasts Chris for his movie choice, and Chris needs to do penance for throwing the pod off its rhythm.

Don’t forget to follow on Instagram!
https://www.instagram.com/snubspod/

A High Tops Media Podcast
You can follow for more High Tops Media content on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter: @hightopsmedia
Check out more podcasts on our website https://hightops.media

entry.title: Rushmore - Season 1 Episode 27
entry.content:
On Snubs, film fans and co-hosts, Caroline Young and Chris Masciarelli, discuss their favorite films that were snubbed by the Oscars. On this episode, our titular hosts discuss Wes Anderson’s, Rushmore, and the 1999 Academy Awards it was noticeably absent from. Caroline does not let Chris get a word in edgewise and Chris thinks Wes Anderson movies are like a warm cup of hot coco in the winter.

Don’t forget to follow on Instagram!
https://www.instagram.com/snubspod/

entry.title: The Breakfast Club - Season 1 Episode 26
entry.content:
On Snubs, film fans and co-hosts, Caroline Young and Chris Masciarelli, discuss their favorite films that were snubbed by the Oscars. On this episode, our titular hosts discuss John Hughes’, The Breakfast Club, and the 1986 Academy Awards it was noticeably absent from. Caroline does not understand the qualifications needed to join the “Brat Pack”, and Chris is just chock full of fun facts.

Don’t forget to follow on Instagram!
https://www.instagram.com/snubspod/

entry.title: The Perks Of Being A Wallflower - Season 1 Episode 25

link.title: The Perks Of Being A Wallflower - Season 1 Episode 25

entry.content:
On Snubs, film fans and co-hosts, Caroline Young and Chris Masciarelli, discuss their favorite films that were snubbed by the Oscars. On this episode, our titular hosts, along with special guest Ryan Young (Caroline’s brother), discuss the teen drama The Perks of Being a Wallflower, and the 2013 Academy Awards it was noticeably absent from. Caroline sees herself in Emma Watson’s character (if she squints really really hard), Chris is a sucker for sentimentality, and Ryan has an unusual tunnel song.

Don’t forget to follow on Instagram!
https://www.instagram.com/snubspod/

A High Tops Media Podcast
You can follow for more High Tops Media content on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter: @hightopsmedia
Check out more podcasts on our website https://hightops.media

entry.title: Big Eyes - Season 1 Episode 24
entry.content:
On Snubs, film fans and co-hosts, Caroline Young and Chris Masciarelli, discuss their favorite films that were snubbed by the Oscars. On this episode, our titular hosts discuss Tim Burton’s, Big Eyes, and the 2015 Academy Awards it was noticeably absent from. Caroline does not think Chris understood the assignment, and Chris thinks that’s hysterical. This entire episode goes a bit off the rails.

Don’t forget to follow on Instagram!
https://www.instagram.com/snubspod/

entry.title: Prisoners - Season 1 Episode 23
entry.content:
On Snubs, film fans and co-hosts, Caroline Young and Chris Masciarelli, discuss their favorite films that were snubbed by the Oscars. On this episode, our titular hosts discuss Denis Villeneuve’s, Prisoners, and the 2014 Academy Awards it was noticeably absent from. Caroline is the president of the Paul Dano fan club, and Chris can not pronounce “Denis Villeneuve” to save his life.

Don’t forget to follow on Instagram!
https://www.instagram.com/snubspod/
